text: - Our clients,

the providers in the
behavioral health system,

didn't get into healthcare
to work with technology.

In fact, most of them want
to spend all their time
working with the clients.

The documentation part is
really the challenge for them,

and often is the area
that you could see as
the factor in terms of burn-out.

Providers generally spend
about 40% of their week
just doing documentation.
The success factor that we see is

can we reduce that
burden of documentation?

We built the solution
with Amazon Chime SDK,

but really extending some
of the capabilities there
with HealthScribe, with Bedrock.
HealthScribe is a powerful platform
that allows us to take those conversations

that providers are
having with the patients

and generate those progress
notes within our solutions.
The problem in behavioral health is

these volumes of narrative,
unstructured information.

One of the benefits in
terms of using Bedrock

is the ability to use
different models within it.
As our starting point, Claude 2 is a model
that has produced great results for us,
and seeing how we can go hone that model
and configure that model

to meet the needs in the
behavioral health space.
Using gen AI tools allows us
to build these solutions much faster.
It allows us to take the foundation models

and enrich those with the
data sets that we have
to ultimately produce those summarizations
or to produce those progress notes
automatically from the system.
We have a lot of sensitive information
within the behavioral health space,
within the addiction space.
There's a lot of regulations around
how we can use that data.

So having those security
components built in,
having the access models built in
to all these services, is a huge benefit

that takes kind of the
burden off of Netsmart
in building that aspect.
